name: Blinded
descr: Can't see. Attacks against you have advantage, and your attacks have disadvantage.

name: Charmed
descr: Sees the charmer as an ally. Charmer has advantage on social interactions with you.

name: Dazed
descr: Heroes: lose 1 action; monsters: can perform one less action on their next turn.

name: Dying
descr: At 0 HP. Taking damage while dying causes 2 Wounds, a crit causes 3 instead.

name: Frightened
descr: Disadvantage on rolls when source of fear is nearby; speed halved when moving closer to it.

name: Grappled/Restrained
descr: Cannot move. Attacks against you have advantage.

name: Hampered
descr: Any creature with their actions or movement reduced (e.g., Dazed, Grappled, Prone, Difficult Terrain).

name: Incapacitated
descr: Can't do anything. Attacks against you have advantage, and melee attacks that hit, crit.

name: Invisible
descr: Cannot be seen. Your attacks have advantage, and attacks against you have disadvantage.

name: Petrified
descr: Incapacitated. You have all the benefits and drawbacks of being a rock! Immune to most damage except from large explosions, picks, or similar tools.

name: Prone
descr: Movement costs twice as much, and disadvantage on attacks. Melee attacks against you have advantage; Ranged have disadvantage. Spend 3 spaces of your Speed to stand up.

name: Riding
descr: You move with the creature you are riding. Any attacks that miss you, strike them.

name: Slowed
descr: Speed halved during your next turn.

name: Taunted
descr: Disadvantage on attacks except against the most recent taunter.

name: Wounded
descr: Has any Wounds (typically 6 Wounds and a hero is dead).

name: Minor Statuses
descr: Minor statuses (Smoldering, Charged, Distracted, etc.) do nothing on their own and end whenever combat does. Some spells and abilities have additional effects against such targets.
